intro: Plectrophora tucanderana, commonly known as the Tucanderan fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Plectrophora tucanderana plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
